column1: #Text=Polycrystalline samples of CePt2In7 were synthesized by first arc-melting stoichiometric quantities of Ce, Pt, and In under Ar atmosphere.
#Text=The reacted ingot was wrapped in Ta foil, sealed under vacuum in a quartz ampoule and annealed for one week.
#Text=Powder x-ray diffraction revealed phase pure material that crystallized in the space group I4/mmm with lattice constants a = 4.602 ˚A and c = 21.601 ˚A (Fig. 1).
#Text=The planar Ce-Ce spacing in CePt2In7, a, is reduced by 8% from that of cubic CeIn3, and is 1% smaller than in CeRhIn5.
#Text=The interplanar distance along the c direction is 10.8 ˚A in CePt2In7, 43% larger than in CeRhIn5.

#Text=Two important structural differences between these two compounds are the alternating Ce-In(1) planes along the c direction that are displaced by half a lattice constant along the [110] direction, and a third set of In sites located halfway between the Ce-In(1) planes that serve to expand the lattice along c direction.
